result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam M Fredrich was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intent. Contribute/Delinquency Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.40(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Brian Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Adam M Fredrich in court with attorney Jonathan A. Lavoy.

State moves to amend the felony to a misdemeanor.
Amended Information filed.
Defense has no objections.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the amended charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the amended charge.


Court orders the following:
175 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
Defendant to report to the Huber Facility no later than 7:00 pm. on:  09/28/15.
Court continues the bail conditions until he reports to the huber facility

Costs: $243
To be paid in full by:  12/01/15
Alternate: 5 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions) - Consecutive.
